meanings.definition: Comply with rules, standards, or laws.
meanings.sent1: She always conforms to the school dress code.
meanings.sent2: The company policy requires all employees to conform to safety regulations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy decided to conform to the 'no chewing' rule... for a minute.
meanings.sent4: His behavior conforms to that of a well-trained professional.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements perfectly conform to the rhythm of the music.

meanings.definition: Be similar in form or type; agree.
meanings.sent1: The new sofa perfectly conforms to the style of the living room.
meanings.sent2: Their opinions on the matter conform with each other.
meanings.sent3: The clouds seemed to conform to the shape of a giant fluffy bunny.
meanings.sent4: Her painting style conforms to the impressionist art movement.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces must conform to each other to complete the picture.
